title: Direction of compass needle near magnets

content.question: The figure above shows a small compass C that is equidistant from the poles of two identical bar magnets. Which of the following best represents the direction that the needle of the compass will point?

choices.label: The figure presents the needle of a compass. North is pointing upward and to the left, and south is pointing downward and to the right.
The figure presents the needle of a compass. South is pointing upward and to the left, and north is pointing downward and to the right.
The figure presents the needle of a compass. South is pointing upward and to the right, and north is pointing downward and to the left.
The figure presents the needle of a compass. North is pointing upward and to the right, and south is pointing downward and to the left.

content.answer: The figure presents the needle of a compass. South is pointing upward and to the left, and north is pointing downward and to the right.
